intro: Xylosma confusa, commonly known as the yellow-wood plant, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Tiliaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by small, woody fruits. Xylosma confusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
